body.p: A dull day dripping with intermittent rain, & threatening fog at the start but improving as the hours passed. I celebrated at 8a.m.: when there were 28 commts: there were 63 at the midday celebration.
At Mattins I preached on Wisdom III.1-5.
The rain held off until Evensong, when it spoiled the Congregation. I preached an old sermon, written as long ago as 1897 and never before used in S. Margaret's.

div.p: Mr Car√∂e has seen me this morning, and we have together visited the Church. I have authorised him to erect the monument on the West wall of the Church, facing outwards into the Porch. He has promised to reduce the cutting into the wall as far as possible. You will, perhaps, be able to fix a date for unveiling it. I think, with the exception of the 15th, 16th, 26th-28th of this month, any day will be convenient to me. You will please see that the form of service desired is submitted to me for approval in good time.
